intro: Octomeria fusiformis, commonly known as the fusiform octomeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its unique, elongated, and often hairy stems. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
